page.title: 04PUBLIC TRANSPORT
page.content: {Public Transport, Pembury.} Today the bus service from Pembury is a twenty minute one, the bus takes about ten minutes to reach Tunbridge Wells, and the journey costs 60 pence. A motorized bus was first introduced between the wars, the journey then cost 3d, and it took 15 minutes. This service replaced horse drawn cabs, kept at the Camden Hotel. The service was two hourly, on week days only. The three and a half mile journey took half an hour. Before the 1920s the roads were very poor. At this date they were tarred over for the first time. Their form has changed very little since. With increased car ownership, the roads are inadequate for today's traffic.
